title: High Court halts RBM bosses case
summary:
By Rebecca Chimjeka Matemba & Pemphero Malimba:

By Rebecca Chimjeka Matemba & Pemphero Malimba:

The High Court of Malawi’s Financial Crimes Division has discontinued two high-profile corruption and financial crimes cases involving former Reserve Bank of Malawi (RBM) governor Dalitso Kabambe, former RBM executive director Henry Mathanga and, in one case, former senior RBM official Cliff Kenneth Chiunda.

In two separate but related orders dated...

title: Ministry hails pact with Spanish club
summary:
The Ministry of Tourism has said its six months agreement with Spanish second-tier football league outfit Club Deportivo Leganés, as part of a strategy to expand Malawi’s brand awareness, was a success.

The agreement, which was signed in January 2023, meant the team wore kits bearing the “Malawi, The Warm Heart of Africa” logo

title: Met sees prospects of good rains
summary:
Climate Change and Meteorological Services says there are strong prospects of good rains in most parts of the country, particularly in March this year.

This was disclosed during a week-long review meeting of the 2025-26 agriculture season which Transforming Agriculture Through Diversification and E...
text_preview:
Climate Change and Meteorological Services says there are strong prospects of good rains in most parts of the country, particularly in March this year.

This was disclosed during a week-long review meeting of the 2025-26 agriculture season which Transforming Agriculture Through Diversification and Entrepreneurship (Trade) Programme organised.

title: Government delays to distribute mathematics textbooks
summary:

Some teachers in the country have expressed concern over the delay by the government to distribute mathematics textbooks for learners in standard 1 to 4, saying this is affecting teaching and learning.

Some teachers in the country have expressed concern over the delay by the government to distribute mathematics textbooks for learners in standard 1 to 4, saying this is affecting teaching and learning.

title: Total withdraws South Africa court case
summary:
By Wezzie Gausi:

In what has become a multi-jurisdictional legal battle, TotalEnergies Marketing Limited has withdrawn its urgent application before the Johannesburg High Court in South Africa, clearing the way for the long-running fuel supply dispute to proceed in the High Court of Malawi.

The de...

By Wezzie Gausi:

In what has become a multi-jurisdictional legal battle, TotalEnergies Marketing Limited has withdrawn its urgent application before the Johannesburg High Court in South Africa, clearing the way for the long-running fuel supply dispute to proceed in the High Court of Malawi.

title: Court orders RBM to compensate bank
summary:
By Isaac Salima:

The Supreme Court of Appeal has ruled against the Reserve Bank of Malawi (RBM)’s decision to revoke the licence for proprietors of Finance Bank.

The Supreme Court of Appeal has ruled against the Reserve Bank of Malawi (RBM)’s decision to revoke the licence for proprietors of Finance Bank.

A seven-member panel of justices, led by Chief Justice Rizine Mzikamanda, heard a case where Finance Bank’s legal team challenged RBM’s decision to revoke the licence in 2005.

title: Suffer Now, Eat Later? Government Defends Painful Economic Plan

title: Tobacco Demand Drops, Raising Concerns for Farmers and the Economy
summary:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also fal...
text_preview:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also falling—from 11 last year to 8 this year. Experts warn that fewer buyers could push prices down, which ...

title: APM Delivers: Over 100,000 Tonnes of Maize from Zambia Begin Arriving in Malawi
summary:
President Peter Mutharika is keeping his promise to fight hunger in Malawi as the first batch of 103,000 metric tonnes of maize—part of the 200,000MT procured from Zambia—begins entering the country through the Mchinji-Mwami border.

Both local and international transporters are moving the maize fro...
text_preview:
President Peter Mutharika is keeping his promise to fight hunger in Malawi as the first batch of 103,000 metric tonnes of maize—part of the 200,000MT procured from Zambia—begins entering the country through the Mchinji-Mwami border.

Both local and international transporters are moving the maize from Zambia’s Food Reserve Agency silos in Chipata to Malawi’s National Food Reserve Agency in Lilongwe...

summary:

About 143 Malawian start-ups have been shortlisted for the 2025 edition of Tony Elumelu Foundation (TEF) entrepreneurship programme, placing Malawi among top seven countries with the highest number of shortlisted candidates.

Nigeria, the programme’s host country, led the selection with 1 463 nominees, followed by Benin with 206, Rwanda 170, Ghana 166, Malawi 143 and Kenya with 23.
